Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Invalidate \In*val"i*date\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Invalidated}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Invalidating}.] [From {Invalid} null.] To render invalid; to weaken or lessen the force of; to destroy the authority of; to render of no force or effect; to overthrow; as, to invalidate an agreement or argument. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
invalidated \invalidated\ adj. deprived of legal force.
Syn: nullified. [WordNet 1.5]
invalidated adj : deprived of legal force [syn: {nullified}]
